page.title: 15Royston Civic Hall
page.content: The Civic Hall is known to the people of Royston as the Welfare Hall.The local people saved one penny weekly to contribute to the building of the Hall.A plaque inside the Hall tells how the Coal Industry Social Welfare Organisation,The Royston Welfare Committee and the Urban District Council all made a joint effort towards the cost.It was opened by F.Page Esq.,J.P.and the R.Hon.The Earl of Scarbrough presented the Council's Grant of Arms and Civic Insignia to the Chairman of the R.U.D.C.The land was given to the people of Royston by Norman Yardley. The Welfare Hall is a very spacious place.It has a stage at one end and next to this is a bar.There is a large comfortable lounge which is adjacent to the ballroom.Next to this is a kitchen.
